Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of a Multimodal Delirium Prevention Intervention in Older Surgical Patients

Participants.evidence: Participants were 1470 patients aged 70 years and older undergoing elective orthopedic, general, or cardiac surgery

Intervention.evidence: The intervention included structured delirium education for caregivers and daily assessment of patient delirium risk factors, with tailored prevention strategies.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates a multifaceted intervention to reduce postoperative delirium incidence and duration.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative delirium incidence, measured daily for seven days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors and patients were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants were 1470 patients aged 70 years and older undergoing elective orthopedic, general, or cardiac surgery from November 2017 to April 2019.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 1470 patients, 763 (51.9%) were male, median age 77 years.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention reduced delirium incidence (odds ratio, 0.87; 95% CI, 0.77-0.98; P = .02) and percentage of days with delirium (5.3% vs 6.9%; P = .03).
